Although the mode of action of hydroxyurea for HCV, HBV, HSV, and B19V is unknown, viral replications were inhibited by hydroxyurea in in vitro studies.
70, 74 â€“ 76 Small-scaled clinical trials showed significant reduction of HCV RNA levels and HBV viral loads in chronic HCV and HBV carriers, respectively.
71, 72 However, there is a case report of an elderly patient with essential thrombocythemia experiencing reactivation of HBV during treatment with hydroxyurea.
73 A retrospective review of children with sickle cell anemia demonstrated decreased requirement of blood transfusion and attenuation of clinical symptoms when using hydroxyurea in patients with B19V infection.
